parameters.name: recall_memory
parameters.description:
Searches your memory system for relevant lessons, patterns, and knowledge from past interactions. Use this tool when:
- You need context about how similar tasks were handled before
- You're unsure which tool or approach to use
- The user references something that might have been discussed previously
- You want to check if there's an established pattern for a task type

The tool searches:
1. Vector similarity on past lessons (semantic search)
2. Keyword matching on patterns and details
3. Persistent knowledge items (facts, preferences, configurations)

Returns: { context_summary, lessons[], persistent_knowledge[] }

values.name: query
values.description: What to search for. Be specific - include task type, tool names, or error messages. Example: 'workflow building with HTTP Request node' or 'fixing connection errors in Auto-Fixer'

values.name: category_filter
values.description: Optional: Filter by category. Options: workflow_building, debugging, data_processing, integration, communication, other

values.name: limit
values.description: Maximum number of lessons to return. Default: 5

values.name: include_failures
values.description: Whether to include lessons from failed attempts. Default: true (failures often have valuable insights)
